lead_paragraph: Mr. Trump was in Washington for meetings with congressional members, including one with Ted Cruz, the Texas senator who came closest to toppling him this year.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Carl Hulse, Jeremy Peters and Emmarie Huetteman from Washington, and Alexander Burns from New York.
byline.original: By ALAN RAPPEPORT, JENNIFER STEINHAUER and MAGGIE HABERMAN

headline.print_headline: Some Senators in G.O.P. Feel Trump’s Wrath
headline.main: Peacemaking Goes Awry as Donald Trump Lashes Out at G.O.P. Senators

snippet: Mr. Trump was in Washington for meetings with congressional members, including one with Ted Cruz, the Texas senator who came closest to toppling him this year....
abstract: Donald J Trump reportedly lashes out at Republican senators during private meeting seeking GOP unity, reflecting lingering fissures within Republican Party as Trump becomes standard-bearer; despite tense exchanges Trump managed to smooth things over with Ted Cruz, whom he had not seen since their heated nomination battle in May.
